Authors: Iskandar K., Harvianto, Zulfikar M.T., Prajena G., Elidjen
Title: Knowledge management point incentive system implementation: A case study
Source title: International Journal of Advanced Trends in Computer Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Iskandar, K., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Harvianto, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Zulfikar, M.T., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Prajena, G., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Elidjen, Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: Knowledge Management System (KMS) has been widely used by companies to manage the intellectual assets of their employees. This research focuses on the problem to motivate employees to share their knowledge and use KMS. Bina Nusantara University in Indonesia becomes the object of the research since the university has implemented KM Portal system. Furthermore, the university has run the KM Award as the reward system. The research method of this study implements a Point Incentive System on the KM Portal for a year and compares the impact with the previous reward system. The reward system used were 1) KM Award System (2018) and 2) Point Incentive System (2019), each of which has been used for one year. This study focuses on comparing the two systems. The research applies quantitative research methodology to measure the number of user contributors and the number of contents in the system. When the numbers show an increase, then this is regarded as the indicator of success. The results show an increase in the number of user contributors by 34.92% and the number of contents by 68.85% stored on the KM Portal. This shows that the application of the KM Point Incentive System is more successful in promoting employees’ motivation to use KMS. © 2020, World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Case Study; Incentive System; Knowledge Management Point Incentive Systems (KMPIS); Knowledge Sharing Motivation
Funding Text 1: This study receives support from Lecturer Applied Research Grant, BINUS University. Thank you to Devina from Language Center, BINUS University for the assistance in proofreading this article.

Authors: Prajena G., Harefa J., Chowanda A., Alexander, Maskat, Rahman K., Fadhil M.N.
Title: The adventure of BipBop: An android app pathfinding adventure game
Source title: Advances in Science, Technology and Engineering Systems
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Game Application Technology Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Prajena, G., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Harefa, J., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Chowanda, A., Game Application Technology Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alexander, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Maskat, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rahman, K., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fadhil, M.N., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to build an android based pathfinding adventure game where user gets information about Indonesian culture, especially the traditional houses including the folk songs and the traditional weapons in certain areas. The method used is by questionnaires, interviews, observation, and literature study. This application also implements the A∗ algorithm to solve the pathfinding problems. The result of this research is "The Adventure of BipBop" app that can make the user can feel the experience of playing that is not only entertaining but also as a medium to convey about the culture of Indonesia and help preserve the traditional house of Indonesia. Most of the respondents find out that the application can provide Indonesian culture well (91.7%). Furthermore, this application can realize about 84.5% of players to help preserve the traditional culture in Indonesia. © 2020 ASTES Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: A∗ algorithm; Adventure puzzle; Artificial intelligence; Culture game; Traditional house
Funding Text 1: This research is partially supported by BINUS University.

Authors: Isabela E., Drona J., Fadhilah N., Tanoto D.F., Harefa J., Prajena G., Chowanda A., Alexander
Title: NYAM: An Android Based Application for Food Finding Using GPS
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Isabela, E., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Drona, J., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fadhilah, N., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Tanoto, D.F., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Harefa, J., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Prajena, G., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Chowanda, A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alexander, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to build an android based application to make easy to find the nearest restaurants where a user can see restaurant profiles, comments, like, amenities rating, hygiene, and services and as well as a media campaign for the restaurants. The method used is by questionnaires, interviews, observation, and literature study. The result of this research is NYAM app that can search for food based on GPS, categories, and types and this app can facilitate the search for suitable eating place where user can see restaurant profiles, comments, like, and amenities rating, hygiene, and service, as well as restaurant owners, can promote a place to eat in this application. Most of the respondents find out that the application was easy to use (94.10%), and features were easy to understand (89.1%). The majority of the respondents (84.10%) will continue to use the NYAM system because they find the NYAM system was helping them to find the best restaurant to have their meals with a decent price and have good tastes (88.40%). © 2018 The Authors. Published by Elsevier Ltd.
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Global positioning system; Surveys; Android; Literature studies; Media campaigns; Mobile; Restaurant Finding; Android (operating system)

Title: ChinaLatex: Web-based assessment system for ubiquitous Chinese education
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Chong, H., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Prajena, G., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Designing high-quality formative and summative assessment system are challenging quest for educators. Effective assessment system requires mastering professional knowledge and skill. The background idea of making the system is to ensure that all students receive fair treatment during the process of learning Chinese. In this study, the authors purpose the analytical concept study of multiple-choice web-based formative assessment; namely web-based formative assessment system (web course system, online Q&A system, online testing system, intelligent management system, learning management system), and paper and pencil test. This paper focus on features, strategy, and effectiveness in the transition from conventional learning to e-learning environment. This paper also purposing problem and solution in the transition, and how the educator can use the assessment system to check student's knowledge after the teachings. Hence, the paper will not present the application used (ChinaLatex) since the author main purpose is sharing the idea behind it and give insight. The analysis of the system intentionally created to expand the insight of increasing effectiveness of learning Chinese ubiquitously by combining science, psychology, and computer in it which is characterized for its positive performance of the whole education (not only Chinese Language). © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: analytical concept; chinalatex concept study; e-learning learning strategy; language study approach
Index Keywords: Computer aided instruction; Education; Information management; Students; Teaching; Websites; analytical concept; Concept studies; Formative and summative assessments; Intelligent management systems; Language study; Learning strategy; Web based assessment systems; Web-based formative assessment; E-learning
